org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode

Class EditLogBackupOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode.EditLogOutputStream
      • org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode.EditLogBackupOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

     class EditLogBackupOutputStream
extends EditLogOutputStream
    An implementation of the abstract class EditLogOutputStream, which streams edits to a backup node.
    See Also:
    (org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.protocol.NamenodeRegistration, int, int, byte[])

      • writeRaw

        public void writeRaw(byte[] bytes,
            int offset,
            int length)
              throws IOException
        Description copied from class: EditLogOutputStream
        Write raw data to an edit log. This data should already have the transaction ID, checksum, etc included. It is for use within the BackupNode when replicating edits from the NameNode.
        Specified by:
        writeRaw in class EditLogOutputStream
        Parameters:
        bytes - the bytes to write.
        offset - offset in the bytes to write from
        length - number of bytes to write
        Throws:
        IOException

        public void create(int layoutVersion)
            throws IOException

      • abort

        public void abort()
           throws IOException
        Description copied from class: EditLogOutputStream

      • setReadyToFlush

        public void setReadyToFlush()
                     throws IOException
        Description copied from class: EditLogOutputStream
        All data that has been written to the stream so far will be flushed. New data can be still written to the stream while flushing is performed.
        Specified by:
        setReadyToFlush in class EditLogOutputStream
        Throws:
        IOException

        Parameters:
